note.p: Birth: Westward, Cumberland, England (02 July 1862)
Death: London (12 March 1942)
Research Field: Physics
Education: King William's College, Castletown, Isle of Man (1875-1881); Trinity College, Cambridge. MA

Career: Eider Professor of Mathematics and Physics, Adelaide University, South Australia (1886-1908); Member, Council of University of Adelaide (1898); Cavendish Professor, Leeds University (1909-1915); Quain Professor of Physics, London University (1915-1923); Resident Director of Research, Admiralty Experimental Station (1916-1917); Scientific Member, Anti-submarine Division, Admiralty (1918); Honorary Fellow, Trinity College, Cambridge (1920); Director, Royal Institution; Fullerian Professor of Chemistry, Royal Institution; Director of Davy-Faraday Research Laboratory (1923); Member, Advisory Council for Scientific and Industrial Research (1937)
Honours: CBE 1917; KBE 1920; OM 1931
Memberships: London Old King William's College Society (President 1933)
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 2/05/1907
Medals/Prizes: Rumford Medal 1916; Copley Medal 1930; Nobel Prize (Physics) 1915
Lectures: Bakerian 1915; Pilgrim Trust 1939
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DSB; King William's College Society
Obituaries: Obituary Notices of Fellows of the Royal Society 1942-1944 vol 4 pp 277-300, plate, by E N da C Andrade, with a bibliography by K Lonsdale
